publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: The masque of queenes : celebrated from the house of fame: by the most absolute in all state, and titles. Anne Queene of Great Britaine, &c. With her honourable ladies. At VVhite Hall, Febr. 2. 1609. Written by Ben: Ionson
monogr.author: Jonson, Ben

div.head: To her sacred Maiestie.
div.p: The same zeale, that studied to make this Invention worthy of yor Maiestyes Name, hath since bene carefull to give it life, and authority: that, what could then be obiected to sight but of a few, might not be defrauded of the applause due to it from all. And, because Princes (out of a religious respect to theyr modesty) may wiselye refuse to be the publique patrons of theyr owne actions; I chose him, that is the next yor sacred Person, and might the worthiest of Mankind give it proper, and naturall defence. The rather since it was his Highnesse command, to haue mee adde this second labor of annotation to my first of Invention: and both to the honor of yor Maiesty.
div.closer: Wherein a hearty desire to please deserues not to offend. By the most loyall, and zealous, to yor Maties seruice, Ben Jonson
